title: API powering ticket distribution
description: 優位性は、既存のチケット販売会社や駐車場サービス会社に見られる特徴です。

f6_assessments.q0: An immutable ticket distribution API would be a nice integration into the Cardano ecosystem. Ticket distribution becomes an issue when potentially multiple reselling is involved. However it isn't a clear how users will be onboarded and why companies would want to adopt the API.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal puts forward a timeline with a budget of development and integration costs. The timeline indicates that the launch is in Q4 of 2022, and fairly logical steps at each high level stage, however it would have been useful to know what was happening within each stage of the roadmap in greater detail. Such as what is the development approach, what steps it involves and who is going to be doing that work. The team that would be integrating the project has not been made public. This would have given me a clearer understanding of whether or not success could be achieved.
f6_assessments.q2: It may be difficult to track the progress of the project from a community prospective since Monate dosen't have a large web footprint from what I can see. There is also a lack of KPI's or definition of success or failure within the proposal to be able to audit the project going forward.

f6_assessments.q0: Peer-to-peer transfer of value is a proven usecase of blockchain tech and traditional event ticketing systems are certainly ripe for an overhaul. Besides the conglomerates who dominate this industry, often running systems in many countries, there are also the more shady scalping industry who take advantage of ticket scarcity. This DApp certainly falls into this challenge and can forward Cardano's mission in this very ubiquitous service. This proposal presents an opportunity for Cardano to penetrate sporting events, cinema and theatre, concerts and festivals and even your local fete if marketed correctly and the right partnerships are formed.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, pertinent information which could have informed on this project's chances for success are missing. The proposer has failed to state their bona fides and experiences in either the ticketing industry or in technical development, be it in blockchain or otherwise. A large part of the proposal was devoted to an explanation of the problem and the rationale for the proposed solution. There were no examples given of past projects, no Linkedin profiles or the like, which could have given this assessment a sense of the abilities of the proposer on delivering the end product. A quarterly roadmap for 2022 was presented with relatively understandable details but there were no measures for success presented, which could have added confidence to this assessment. I recommend that should this proposal miss out on funding this round, that it be revisited with more details on the activities from each quarterly milestone as well as a list of what success could look like. Adding the proposer/s previous experiences and skillset would also be beneficial, as well as any other members of the team, particularly from the technical side who would have validated some of the technical developments presented here.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal certainly presented milestones or builds at each quarter with matching dollar values and this could form the basis of a possible audit. However, and as state by the proposer him/herself, the team is yet to be recruited. This places a question mark on the validity of the requested budget itself as it does not leave any room for a difference in fees for say, the API developer who may expect a higher payment than what is allocated for the job. This lack of granular detail endangers the funding amount requested. I suggest this proposal is revisited at a later funding round with a full team recruited even on an MoU, to solidify the amount of funding needed. It could also lead to a more detailed development/deployment path with more accurate timelines and more measurable points for success.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is for developing a Cardano-based API service to sell tickets for events and other activities. The proposal has the potential to revolutionize the event ticket management industry. Even a proof of concept in this can create awareness in the industry participants.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has no details regarding the proposers' experience or past work.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan presented is reasonable and is addressing one of the important issues in event management and other related money collection activities. The proposal has limited details regarding who and how the system will be developed and where it will be field-tested. It is difficult to estimate the auditability of the proposal with the available information.

f6_assessments.q0:
Given that the challenge aims to increase adoption through DAAps this does aim to support that, however, it seems to be in an indirect way by building a ticketing platform that uses Cardano as a replacement for traditional ticketing intermediaries such as tiqets.com. 
It is a great idea, however, it misses a direct link or explanation explaining how it links to the challenge of the campaign.
f6_assessments.q1:
When it comes to feasibility, this project has a rough roadmap, however, it lacks some essential elements. First, there are no details about the team and experience, I would have liked to see details about who is behind this and their background with APIs and the event industry. Second, the timeline seems arbitrary and does not go into detail in, for example, the number of people needed to develop the software. Third, step 1 aims to use Q4 of 2021 to do "Deployment & Development research" and would only cost 200$, this seems not proportional to what usual research for this type of project. Having been involved in prototyping a marketplace built on a blockchain network I would estimate this to be at least 10x higher regardless of where you are based geographically.
Lastly, the roadmap and plan do not explain what technologies will be used, front-end and back-end and, challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation were not considered.
f6_assessments.q2: While the roadmap does provide milestones with "dates' and approximate budget requirements for each, factors that ensure auditing are lacking. There are no key performance indicators mentioned that would enable the community to track the success of this project such as the number of users, or the number of transactions (of ADA) that would be generated on the platform.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is in the correct challenge, yet fails to quantify transaction expectations and other key metrics for this challenge.

If this project is an integration project, what specific systems are being integrated with?
f6_assessments.q1:
No experience is provided, nor is there any information about a team. We do see reference to seeking new members and contractors in the section speaking about use of the funds.

The proposer avoided answering the Experience required field by typing in a period "."  . This may have been an oversight in final editing, but it leaves the assessor and voter with little knowledge of the experience.
f6_assessments.q2: The budgetary breakdown does not align with the project  details above, and there is little to assist in the audit of work accomplished or how the funds were allocated across the effort.
